channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Kristin Branson
item.description:
For the Cajal summer school on Machine Learning for Neuroscience, I gave this presentation yesterday on trends in #ML from 2000-present. I had lots of fun making these slides -- it was nice to get to talk about ML from the '00s (all this knowledge stored in my brain that never gets to come out!) and what I thought were the important trends of the past quarter century.
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/17b6xzZXQKMRyvWX5DGD6WyPWnk-NSzE4OiRrmJb_gg0/edit?usp=sharing

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
If the neurons are musicians in an orchestra, the brain regions are their sections, and the memory is the music they produce, the study‚Äôs authors said, then the electric field is the conductor.Brain networks encoding memory come together via electric fields, study finds.
https://picower.mit.edu/news/brain-networks-encoding-memory-come-together-electric-fields-study-finds

item.title: Robert Reich
item.description: The upward redistribution of wealth over the past 45 years has shifted $50 trillion from the bottom 90% to the top 1%. That‚Äôs $50 trillion that would have gone into the paychecks of working Americans.The wealth doesn‚Äôt ‚Äútrickle down.‚Äù It gushes up.

item.title: Litzz11

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Debian is still rock solid. Just upgraded Stretch -> Buster -> Bullseye -> Bookworm with zero issues.

item.title: UCL NeuroAI

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description:
Cool lineup. And it's open on Zoom."Exploring Natural Intelligence: Perspectives on brain evolution, development, and organization"July 7 (in South Korea; that might be July 6, depending where you are)The schedules is (times are local SK time, I assume; Zoom info in poster):
9:30~9:35 Opening remark
9:40~10:35 Moria Dillon
10:40~11:35 Paul Cisek
11:40~12:35 Celeste Kidd
12:35~12:55 Panel Discussion
14:30~15:25 Casey Paquola
15:30~16:25 Se-Bum Paik
16:30~17:25 Alex Jordan
17:25~17:50 Panel Discussioninfo from a twitter post by Seng Bum Michael Yoo (neuromochi)

item.title: Friedemann Zenke
item.description: Announcing SNUFA 2023: 7-8 November (online). Your friendly focus meeting on spiking neural networks. Invited speakers: Rodolphe Sepulchre, Melika Payvand, Gabriel Ocker, Jeff Krichmar. Abstract submission open! https://snufa.net/2023. w/ Charlotte Frenkel, Emre Neftci, and @neuralreckoning

item.title: Dean Burnett (that brains guy)
item.description: "We never saw any of this ADHD or autism stuff when I was young!" You never saw any photos of the surface of Mars back then either, but I'm pretty sure it was still there the whole time

item.title: JB Emmons
item.description: The question presented: "Whether the Sixteenth Amendment authorizes Congress to tax unrealized sums without apportionment among the states."The goal: to preempt any future wealth or "billionaire" tax.With cert granted two weeks ago (despite the absence of a circuit split), these conservative activists could be on the cusp of undermining the tax code for generations.Note too the link between amici and the billionaire friends of Alito & Thomas.#SCOTUS #LawFedihttps://talkingpointsmemo.com/muckraker/to-sabotage-or-not-sabotage-the-tax-code-for-scotus-thats-the-question

item.title: Grace Lindsay
item.description: What are the foundational principles of #neuroscience? By which I mean: beliefs or assumptions that animate our study of the brain across topics. Things like a belief in a structure-function relationship or the neuron as the base unit.

item.title: Sepiedeh Keshavarzi
item.description: Our review paper on #cortical integration of #vestibular and #visual signals is now out on @AnnualReviews. We delve into the fascinating topic, shedding light on knowledge gaps and suggesting promising directions for future research. Check it out! #multisensoryintegration #percepcion #spatialnavigation #selfmotion #cortex #neurosciene #neuralcircuits https://doi.org/10.1146/annurev-neuro-120722-100503

item.title: Konrad Rokicki
item.description:
Our software engineering team at HHMI‚Äôs Janelia Research Campus is hiring a research software engineer to develop web applications supporting our primary research areas in neuroscience and 4D cellular physiology. Janelia is an internally funded non-profit research campus, and our team provides shared software development services to the labs and projects.
More info here: https://hhmi.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/External/job/Senior-Software-Engineer---Web-Applications_R-2142
